input: Generate a coherence output. Keyphrase: many people;abandon a portion;contract;signed a contract;a breach;fellow soldiers;will undertake certain duties;civilians;result in the deaths;breach;benefits;the wrong time;the duties;enlist in the military;exchange;the pay;a severe crime<extra_id_98>Title: CMV : Military desertion should not be a crime as it is an entirely normal human behavior and invokes on the right of freedom of speech and prosecution of such can often be observed as external coercion which goes against freedom of action.

To then take the pay and benefits but abandon a portion of the duties without fulfilling them is at the very least breach of contract. As this is a breach of contract that can, when done at the wrong time, result in the deaths of many people ( either civilians or fellow soldiers ), I can very easily see it being a severe crime to be punished.
